description_txt: stated on January 7, 2013 in a speech on the House floor:
quote_txt: "I am now the No. 2 member of this House in terms of length of service."

description_txt: stated on December 19, 2012 in in a letter:
quote_txt: In 2010, 2,694 young people were killed by gunfire. 1,773 were victims of homicide; 67 were elementary school-age children.

description_txt: stated on January 16, 2013 in his State of the State address:
quote_txt: The state budget proposal has been submitted "on time and [it's] the earliest that a governor has done so in over two decades."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • January 18, 2013

description_txt: stated on January 8, 2013 in State of the State address:
quote_txt: "Gross income tax receipts are exceeding the Administration’s projections for this fiscal year prior to Sandy."

description_txt: stated on January 3, 2013 in an online video:
quote_txt: "Unlike the gridlock in Washington, more than 80 percent of the bills we passed during this General Assembly had bipartisan support."

description_txt: stated on January 9, 2013 in a press conference.:
quote_txt: Says Texas public school funding grew three times the rate of enrollment from 2002 to 2012.

description_txt: stated on January 12, 2013 in an interview:
quote_txt: The United States has "an immigration system where only 6.5 percent of people who come here, come here based on labor and skill."

description_txt: stated on December 12, 2012 in a newsletter:
quote_txt: "In Minnesota, well over 6,200 election-day registrations from 2008 proved fraudulent."

description_txt: stated on January 6, 2013 in a chain email message:
quote_txt: Members of Congress "specifically exempted themselves from many of the laws they have passed, such as being exempt from any fear of prosecution for sexual harassment" ... (and) from the healthcare reform."

description_txt: stated on January 10, 2013 in a speech:
quote_txt: U.S. Senate candidate Todd Akin was "partly right" that a woman's body has a way of shutting down so that a pregnancy doesn't occur if she's raped.

description_txt: stated on January 3, 2013 in a council resolution:
quote_txt: "Semi-automatic weapons, whether pistol or rifle, were designed for use by the military on the battlefield."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • January 16, 2013

description_txt: stated on January 11, 2013 in an editorial board interview:
quote_txt: "I sponsored the amendment that expanded the hours of early voting so that people who have irregular work schedules could vote."

description_txt: stated on December 31, 2012 in an opinion piece in the Austin American-Statesman:
quote_txt: Says in "our region," 2011 was worst drought year ever recorded.

description_txt: stated on January 2, 2013 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: The fiscal cliff deal "increased spending."

description_txt: stated on January 9, 2013 in a press release:
quote_txt: "Even if you took literally every single ounce of platinum in the world, it still wouldn’t add up to enough needed to pay down our nation’s debt."

description_txt: stated on January 1, 2013 in a statement on campaign website:
quote_txt: "200 consumer laws were destroyed" in 2011 when Gov. Scott Walker signed Act 92.

description_txt: stated on January 6, 2013 in an interview on Fox News Sunday:
quote_txt: Seven of America’s 10 wealthiest counties are in the Washington, D.C., area.

description_txt: stated on January 1, 2013 in a letter:
quote_txt: "[W]e see America's prison population exploding, with America having a greater percentage of its people behind bars than any other nation in the world!"

description_txt: stated on December 11, 2012 in a letter to congressional leadership:
quote_txt: Since the federal Violence Against Women Act was adopted in 1994, "cases of domestic violence have fallen by 67 percent."

description_txt: stated on December 31, 2012 in an interview on WOR-AM:
quote_txt: Says "how much money the government is collecting from people...in terms of the gross domestic product" is "the lowest in 40, 50 years."

description_txt: stated on January 3, 2013 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: "The amount of money that we put into running our own state legislature is nearly as much as we put into the University of Rhode Island."

description_txt: stated on January 4, 2013 in a tweet. :
quote_txt: Says if you are on your bike in a crosswalk, all you have to do is dip your wheel into the road and cars must legally stop.

description_txt: stated on January 8, 2013 in a press release:
quote_txt: Says Chuck Hagel "opposed sanctions against Iran."

description_txt: stated on December 21, 2012 in an email sent to PolitiFact Texas:
quote_txt: Says 11 states have more people on welfare than employed.

description_txt: stated on January 6, 2013 in a chain email message:
quote_txt: Members of Congress can "retire with the same pay after only one term" in office

description_txt: stated on January 2, 2013 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: The fiscal cliff deal "ultimately raised taxes."

description_txt: stated on January 8, 2013 in a news conference. :
quote_txt: Says his transportation plan "would make Virginia the first state in the nation to eliminate the state tax on gasoline."

description_txt: stated on January 8, 2013 in a speech:
quote_txt: "A far different picture from the prior eight years, which saw 115 increases in taxes and fees."

description_txt: stated on January 8, 2013 in a Twitter post.:
quote_txt: Says Texas is "dead last in support for mental health."

description_txt: stated on December 21, 2012 in a newspaper column:
quote_txt: Obamacare includes "a $63 charge every American will begin paying (in 2013) as a way to cover some of the increased costs associated with providing health insurance to those with pre-existing conditions."
